result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristina K. Keppert
Current: Taycheedah Correctional Institution 751 Co Rd K, Fond du Lac, WI 54937 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2022)
Prior: 50 E Spruce Street, Chippewa County Jail, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States

9:26 AM 
Defendant Kristina K. Keppert in custody via videoconference from Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Ryan Raymond in court.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received the Information and enters pleas of Not Guilty.  Defendant waives personal appearance.  Not Guilty pleas received and 20 days granted for motions.  Defendant requests address be updated to Taycheedah Correctional.
Status Conference: December 5, 2022 at 1:30 PM (Defendant can appear remotely from custody, counsel may appear remotely as well if just scheduling further)

(2:00 PM cases 22CF940, 22CF1008 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Kristina K. Keppert in court, in custody. Attorney Andrew T Knaak and Attorney Ryan Raymond in court for Kristina K. Keppert. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
22CF1008:
State calls Investigator Lance Maske of the Eau Claire County Sheriff's Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Raymond conducts cross-examination of Investigator Maske. 
State conducts redirect of Investigator Maske. Witness excused.
State makes argument for bind over.
Attorney Raymond makes argument against bind over.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Arraignment in 22CF1008 to be scheduled with Branch 6 Judicial Assistant.
22CF940:
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF940 and Court accepts waiver. 
Arraignment in 22CF940 to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.
